answers.q: what is aluminium sulfate used for
answers.a: As a food additive (E520), aluminium sulfate is used in small amounts as a firming agent and acidity regulator, for example in pickling and some baking powders; outside food it’s widely used as a coagulant in water treatment and papermaking.

answers.q: what is aluminium sulphate used for
answers.a: In foods, E520 serves mainly as a firming agent and acidity regulator (e.g., pickling, some baking mixes), while industrially it’s used as a coagulant for water purification and in paper production.

answers.q: 3 sulfate ions for every 2 aluminium ions what is the solute
answers.a: That stoichiometry corresponds to aluminium sulfate, Al2(SO4)3—the solute is aluminium sulfate.

answers.q: aluminium sulphate when dissolved in water forms
answers.a: It dissociates into Al3+ and SO4^2− ions; the aluminium ion hydrolyzes in water to acidic aquo complexes and can form Al(OH)3 depending on pH.

answers.q: dell dimmesion e520 lights 1,3,4 green what does that mean
answers.a: That appears to be a Dell Dimension E520 computer diagnostic code, not the E520 food additive aluminium sulfate; please consult Dell’s service manual for the light pattern meaning.
